Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration: This project supports 8-12 graduate students for their travel to attend the 2015 IEEE Conference on Communications and Network Security (CNS). The CNS workshop is a relatively young conference started by the IEEE Communications Society in 2013, focused on the lower levels of the networking stack (i.e., at the physical layer), as compared to the higher levels addressed by conferences such as the Network and Distributed System Security Symposium (NDSS), ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS), etc. By supporting attendance for these graduate students, this award helps grow a next generation of researchers with expertise in secure communications. Participation of women and underrepresented minorities will be encouraged.

Institution.Name: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
Institution.ORG_LGL_BUS_NAME: VIRGINIA POLYTECHNIC INSTITUTE AND STATE UNIVERSITY

Performance_Institution.Name: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

POR.DRECONTENT:
This project has provided travel support for 8 US-based graduate students, including one female students, to attend the IEEE CNS - IEEE Conference on Communications and Network Security. IEEE CNS conference is  a core IEEE ComSoc conference that serves as a premier forum for communications and network researchers,practitioners, policy makers, and users to exchange ideas, techniques and tools, raise aware-ness, and share experience related to security and privacy. It  provides a unique forum to bridge the communications and networking community and the security community. The topic covered at this conference range from computer and network forensics, to data and application security and cyber-physical systems' security. These travel grants enabled the selected students to attend the conference so at to interact with their peers and to get acquainted with the state-of-the-art research in the fields of cyber-security, wireless security, and network forensics. Such a conference experience is critical to the career of graduate students and, given the fact that the selected students were mostly at an early stage of their career, the attendance of IEEE CNS is expected to have enhanced their overall view on the field of secure and trustworthy cyberspace. Overall, these travel grants provided a unique networking opportunity for those students.


Last Modified: 03/01/2016
Modified by: Walid Saad
